chinese: (BrE wholemeal) 用全麦做的；用全麦面粉做的
examples: e.g. The cool temperature helps keep [[whole wheat]] flour fresh for longer.

chinese: [C, U] 火腿（肉）
cook under or over direct heat 烤；烧；焙
examples: e.g. The meat tastes best when you [[grill]] it for 20 minutes on each side.

chinese: make (bread, cheese, etc.) brown by placing it close to heat 烤，烘（面包、奶酪等）
examples: e.g. [[Toast]] the bread lightly on both sides and it will be ready.；e.g. I'd like a coffee and two slices of [[toast]] with butter.

chinese: [U] bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft 烤面包（片）；吐司
examples: e.g. [[Toast]] the bread lightly on both sides and it will be ready.；e.g. I'd like a coffee and two slices of [[toast]] with butter.

chinese: [C] a person who studies history and / or writes about it 历史学家；史学工作者
examples: e.g. His father is a famous [[historian]], specializing in the history of Germany.

chinese: [U] the quality of being good at finding ways to deal with difficult situations 机智；有办法
examples: e.g. Because of his adventures, he is a person of far greater experience and [[resourcefulness]].

chinese: [U] the process of entering another country to make one's life there 移居；移民入境
examples: e.g. The government has decided to tighten the [[immigration]] policy.

chinese: [U] (BrE also globalisation) the process of making sth. such as a business operate in a lot of different countries all around the world, or the result of this 全球化
examples: e.g. Economic [[globalization]] has changed the nature of competition among cities in developing countries.

chinese: [C, U] (pl. tuna or tunas) 金枪鱼（肉）
(fml.) (~ from / in) come from a particular place or start in a particular situation 开始；发源
examples: e.g. All theories [[originate]] from practice and in turn serve practice.

chinese: reduce the amount of money, time, goods, etc. that you use 削减；节省
examples: e.g. He tried to [[conserve]] on fuel during the long winter.；e.g. We must [[conserve]] our forests and woodlands for our future generations.

chinese: keep sth. from being wasted, damaged, lost, or destroyed 保护；保存
examples: e.g. He tried to [[conserve]] on fuel during the long winter.；e.g. We must [[conserve]] our forests and woodlands for our future generations.

chinese: [U, sing.] a larger amount of sth. than is allowed or needed 过分；过量
examples: e.g. The test revealed an [[excess]] of alcohol in the driver's blood.

chinese: (~s) [pl.] food remaining uneaten after a meal 剩饭菜
examples: e.g. At my grandma's, we sometimes had [[leftovers]] and it was my grandpa who ate them.；e.g. This recipe makes use of [[leftover]] chicken from the roast chicken recipe.

chinese: (only before noun) remaining after all the rest has been used, taken, or eaten 未用完的；剩余的；未吃完的
examples: e.g. At my grandma's, we sometimes had [[leftovers]] and it was my grandpa who ate them.；e.g. This recipe makes use of [[leftover]] chicken from the roast chicken recipe.

chinese: [U] 蛋黄酱
[C, U] 莴苣；生菜
1) [C, U] behavior and attitudes that most people in a society consider to be normal and right 惯例；常规；习俗
examples: e.g. It is a matter of [[convention]] that businessmen should wear suits.；e.g. They have chosen him to represent their city at the [[convention]].

chinese: 2) [C] a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests 大会；会议；集会
examples: e.g. It is a matter of [[convention]] that businessmen should wear suits.；e.g. They have chosen him to represent their city at the [[convention]].

chinese: 1) movement (as of goods or people) into, through, and out of a place （货物、人员等的）流动，流通；吞吐
examples: e.g. The restaurant did a lively business and had a rapid [[turnover]].；e.g. I believe they've doubled their [[turnover]] since those advertisements appeared in the press.

chinese: 2) [U, sing.] (BrE) the amount of business done during a particular period 营业额
examples: e.g. The restaurant did a lively business and had a rapid [[turnover]].；e.g. I believe they've doubled their [[turnover]] since those advertisements appeared in the press.

chinese: (of food) preserved in a tin （食物）罐装的
examples: e.g. They tend to buy cheap processed foods like [[canned]] chicken.

chinese: [sing.] the disadvantage or negative aspect of sth. 不利方面
examples: e.g. There is a [[downside]] of living in the countryside: It takes a long time to commute to work.

chinese: [U] the state of being liked, enjoyed, or supported by a large number of people 流行；受欢迎
examples: e.g. We are doing a weekly poll on the president, and clearly his [[popularity]] has declined.

chinese: not deliberate 无意的；无心的
examples: e.g. Technological advances are sometimes accompanied by [[unintended]] consequences such as pollution and global warming.

chinese: 1) (~s) [pl.] food left after a meal 残羹剩饭
examples: e.g. The rats run around, searching for [[scraps]] in the rubbish.；e.g. He wrote his address on a [[scrap]] of paper.

chinese: 2) [C] a small piece of paper, cloth, etc. 小片；小块；碎屑
examples: e.g. The rats run around, searching for [[scraps]] in the rubbish.；e.g. He wrote his address on a [[scrap]] of paper.

chinese: [C, U] the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong 良心；良知
examples: e.g. I have battled with my [[conscience]] over whether I should actually send this letter.

chinese: [U] the study of the environment and the belief that it must be protected from damage by human activities 环境保护主义
examples: e.g. The teacher asked the students to find more information on [[environmentalism]] on the Internet.

chinese: [C] a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills （社会）精英；上层人士
examples: e.g. In this country, only the [[elite]] can afford an education for their children.

chinese: [C] a metal pan over a heater, used to cook or to keep things warm at the table （有加热装置的）火锅，暖锅
examples: e.g. Last Friday I got back to town and had [[chafing dishes]] with my family members.

chinese: [C] 三角形；三角形物体
[C] 牙签
1) [U] the act of combining or state of being combined 联合；组合
examples: e.g. After running through the numbers in every possible [[combination]], we finally hit on a solution.；e.g. The best approach may well be to use a [[combination]] of both methods.

chinese: 2) [C] two or more things joined or mixed together to form a single unit 结合体；联合体；混合体
examples: e.g. After running through the numbers in every possible [[combination]], we finally hit on a solution.；e.g. The best approach may well be to use a [[combination]] of both methods.

chinese: [U] the quality of being attractive and showing a good sense of style 高雅
examples: e.g. In the dining room the decoration creates an atmosphere of [[elegance]].

chinese: lasting or intended to last for a long time or forever 长久的；永久的
examples: e.g. Heavy drinking can cause [[permanent]] damage to the brain.

chinese: 1) food cooked in a certain way 菜肴；饭菜
examples: e.g. The dining room has lakeside views and offers excellent [[cuisine]].；e.g. Chinese [[cuisine]] is an art, which grew out of a highly developed civilization.

chinese: 2) a particular style of cooking 烹饪（法）
examples: e.g. The dining room has lakeside views and offers excellent [[cuisine]].；e.g. Chinese [[cuisine]] is an art, which grew out of a highly developed civilization.

chinese: not liking changes or new ideas 保守的；守旧的
examples: e.g. The young people are the most eager to learn and the least [[conservative]] in their thinking.

chinese: [U] dislike of changes or new ideas 保守；守旧主义
examples: e.g. Jones himself was a curious mixture of radicalism (激进主义) and [[conservatism]].

chinese: [U] the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country, etc. 忠诚；忠贞；忠实
examples: e.g. I was deeply impressed by his [[loyalty]] to his brother.

chinese: small, pretty, and delicate 小巧的；精致的
examples: e.g. We visited her uncle's place and were given tea and some [[dainty]] little cakes.

chinese: [U] 炒面
[C] a university degree of the highest level 博士学位
examples: e.g. He received his [[doctorate]] in political science at Columbia University.

chinese: [C] sth. which cannot be explained or understood 神秘的事；不可思议的事
examples: e.g. It's a [[mystery]] to me how she ever passed that exam.

chinese: for the stated kind and no other; particularly 专门地；特定地；具体地
examples: e.g. I asked her to repeat [[specifically]] the words that Patti had used.

chinese: 1) (BrE also bap) 小圆面包
2) (BrE) 小圆糕点
[U]（调味用的）肉汁
1) of a very typical and well-known kind 典型的
examples: e.g. Too many job hunters make the [[classic]] mistake of thinking only about what's in it for them.；e.g. Huckleberry Finn is a [[classic]] children's movie.

chinese: 2) of the highest quality or class and esp. serving as a model 一流的；经典的
examples: e.g. Too many job hunters make the [[classic]] mistake of thinking only about what's in it for them.；e.g. Huckleberry Finn is a [[classic]] children's movie.

chinese: (of food) making one's stomach feel full （食物）耐饥的，果腹的
examples: e.g. Although it is tasty, crab is not very [[filling]].

chinese: eat sth. steadily and often noisily, esp. sth. hard and / or dry 大声嚼，用力嚼（尤其硬或干的食物）
examples: e.g. The horse was [[munching]] away at my hat.

chinese: [C] (esp. BrE) （工厂、学校等的）食堂，餐厅
[C] （美国和加拿大的）十分硬币
[C] (infml.) a person living in a foreign country 居住在国外的人；侨民
examples: e.g. I had the vague idea that I could now vote electronically, but in fact no [[expat]] can do so.

chinese: ask sb. for help 请求···的帮助
examples: e.g. She urged him to [[reach out to]] his family.

chinese: that you choose by yourself 自己选择（或选定）的
examples: e.g. Meals on a tour like ours could be eaten in any restaurant of one's [[choosing]].

chinese: (make you) eat enough food so that you no longer feel hungry 使吃饱
examples: e.g. They [[filled]] me up with cakes and sandwiches.

chinese: if you start sth. from scratch, you begin it without using anything that existed or was prepared before 从头做起；从零开始
examples: e.g. It's completely ruined, so we'll have to start from scratch.

chinese: think of an idea, answer, etc. 想出，提出（主意、答案等）
examples: e.g. The airline has [[come up with]] a novel solution to the problem of jet lag.

chinese: (AmE) (of cooked food sold in a shop) be taken away and not eaten in the shop （食物）带出餐馆吃的，外卖的
examples: e.g. "Two chicken dinners with corn [[to go]], please," he said in a hurry.

chinese: need sth. 需要
examples: e.g. This kind of work [[calls for]] a lot of patience.

chinese: up to and including the present moment 至今
examples: e.g. Even [[to this day]] we don't know what happened for sure.

chinese: because of 由于；因为
examples: e.g. The company has had a successful year, thanks to the improvement in export sales.

波士顿大学（美国大学，位于马萨诸塞州）
